item.title: Covid: Yousaf warns 'cases will rise' as restrictions ease
item.description: The health secretary warns that the pandemic "is not over" ahead of Monday's significant milestone.

item.title: Drivers in Scotland warned due to more downpours and floods
item.description: A yellow warning remains in place after torrential rain closed railway lines and flooded streets on Saturday.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: How 'bulletproof' mentality propelled Josh Kerr to 1500m medal
item.description: Olympic 1500m bronze medallist Josh Kerr tells BBC Scotland how a "bulletproof mentality" helped him become only Scotland's third individual track medallist in 100 years.

item.title: Man's body discovered in crashed car near Castletown
item.description: Police inform the family of a man who had been reported missing, after the vehicle was found near Castletown.

item.title: 'I finally feel at home working as a surgeon in Scotland'
item.description: Dr Maya Shahsavari came to the UK as a refugee from Iran and is now a ear, nose and throat surgeon.

item.title: Cyclist thought he would die after Portsoy bridge plunge
item.description: Junior doctor Duncan Brown fell 30ft and ended up submerged in the water below the Aberdeenshire bridge.

item.title: Covid-19: Quarantine-free travel from France resumes as UK rules change
item.description: Some travel firms report a "surge" of bookings but others say it is "too late to save the summer".

item.title: Covid in Scotland: More groups eligible for winter flu jabs
item.description: All over-50s, teachers, school staff and pupils and those working on Covid testing will be offered the jab.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Physical distancing to remain in healthcare settings
item.description: The 2m requirement will remain in hospitals and GP surgeries, Scotland's health secretary has confirmed.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Drop-in vaccine clinics open for 16-17-year-olds
item.description: Covid vaccines will be offered to the teenagers as early as this weekend, according to Health Secretary Humza Yousaf.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: How will the rules change on 9 August?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions is set to end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Do I need a vaccine certificate to travel?
item.description: The documents could be used in an international vaccine passport programme enabling foreign travel.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: 'Give us money and weâ€™ll tackle the climate crisis'
item.description: Women in one of the most deprived parts of Glasgow say they can help their communities tackle climate change.

item.title: Capturing the disappearing sounds of the workplace
item.description: An archive preserving sounds from offices, factories and shops will also be a resource for artists and musicians.

item.title: COP26: What is the UN climate conference in Glasgow and why is it so important?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: Boris Johnson: Why mining gaffe will linger after Scottish visit
item.description: Boris Johnson put his foot in it by joking that Margaret Thatcher gave the UK a "big early start" in the shift away from coal.

item.title: Edinburgh Fringe: 'It does feel like a different sort of festival'
item.description: No posters, pop-up performances or flyers as a socially-distanced Edinburgh Fringe gets under way.

item.title: Women's health: I'm in pain but it took years for anyone to listen
item.description: Women tell of lengthy and painful waits for diagnoses ahead of a new government report on women's health.

item.title: COP26: How serious is the government about climate conference?
item.description: With less than 90 days to go to Glasgow climate summit, there is uncertainty surrounding the event.

item.title: Alastair Bruce: 'When I joined the army it was illegal to be gay'
item.description: Maj Gen Alastair Bruce is the highest ranking officer in the British army to have a same-sex wedding.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Josh Kerr 1500m wins bronze as Jakob Ingebrigtsen takes gold
item.description: Team GB's Josh Kerr wins bronze in the men's 1500m, with the second fastest time ever by a British athlete, as Norway's Jakob Ingebrigtsen takes gold.

item.title: Laura Muir: Watch Team GB star win brilliant 1500m silver at Tokyo Olympics
item.description: Laura Muir wins a superb silver medal, shattering the British record, to finish behind Kenya's defending champion Faith Kipyegon in the 1500m final at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Laura Kenny and Katie Archibald win historic gold in women's madison
item.description: Laura Kenny becomes the first British woman to win gold at three Olympic Games as she and Katie Archibald are crowned madison champions in Tokyo.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer: 'Shetland oil field should be blocked'
item.description: The Labour leader says approval should not be given for a new oil and gas development west of Shetland.

item.title: PM's full interview on visit to Scotland
item.description: Boris Johnson sets out views on the UK working together, the COP26 conference and Scottish drug deaths.

item.title: Watch: Sportscene - Scottish Premiership highlights
item.description: Watch highlights of the weekend's Scottish Premiership action on Sportscene, with Steven Thompson, Michael Stewart and Steven Naismith.

item.title: Celtic 6-0 Dundee: Kyogo Furuhashi scores hat-trick as Ange Postecoglou gets first league win
item.description: The outstanding Kyogo Furuhashi scores a hat-trick as Celtic sweep aside Dundee to give manager Ange Postecoglou a rousing first Scottish Premiership victory in front of 24,500 fans.

item.title: Hibernian 3-0 Ross County: Josh Doig back as Easter Road side go top
item.description: Hibernian join Hearts at the top of the Scottish Premiership with Josh Doig playing his part in a resounding win over Ross County.

item.title: Livingston 1-2 Aberdeen: Jack MacKenzie nets late winner for Dons
item.description: Jack MacKenzie's stoppage-time winner earns a dramatic Scottish Premiership win for Aberdeen over Livingston.

item.title: Hero Open: Grant Forrest realises 'dream' with first European Tour title in St Andrews
item.description: Scotland's Grant Forrest secures his first European Tour title with a fine birdie-birdie finish on home soil at the Hero Open at St Andrews.
